lootbeams.config.title: Lootbeams
lootbeams.config.listSyntax: All item lists entries can be any of the following: {modid}:{item} (that item only), #{tag} (all items in the tag), or {modid} (all items in the mod).
lootbeams.config.renderDistance.tooltip: How close the player has to be to see the beam. (note: in vanilla items stop rendering at 24 blocks.)
lootbeams.config.requireGround.tooltip: If the item needs to be on the ground to render the Loot Beam.
lootbeams.config.renderCondition.tooltip: The general requirement for an item to render a Loot Beam.
lootbeams.config.renderWhitelist.tooltip: Items that should render a loot beam regardless of the render condition.
lootbeams.config.renderBlacklist.tooltip: Items that should not render a loot beam no matter what.
lootbeams.config.beamYOffset.tooltip: The Y offset of the beam.
lootbeams.config.whiteBeamCenter.tooltip: Should the beam render a white center beam.
lootbeams.config.beamShadow.tooltip: Should the beam render a glowing shadow.
lootbeams.config.animateShadow.tooltip: Should the beam's shadow be animated with the item bobbing.
lootbeams.config.beamRenderMode.tooltip: Controls the texture and shader of the beam.
lootbeams.config.beamColorMode.tooltip: What should determine the color of the beam.
lootbeams.config.customColors: You cannot edit custom colors in the gui, you must edit the config file directly.
lootbeams.config.beamParticles.tooltip: Should any beam particles be rendered.
lootbeams.config.particleCount.tooltip: How many particles should spawn per second.
lootbeams.config.particleLifetime.toolti: The lifetime of the particles in ticks.
lootbeams.config.particleCondition.toolt: The general condition for particles to render.
lootbeams.config.particleWhitelist.toolt: Items that should render particles regardless of the render condition.
lootbeams.config.particleBlacklist.toolt: Items that should not render particles no matter what.
lootbeams.config.beamNameplate.tooltip: Should any nameplates be rendered. Nameplates consist of the item name, count(configurable), and rarity(configurable).
lootbeams.config.nameplateOnLook.tooltip: Should the nameplate render when looking at items.
lootbeams.config.nameplateLookSensitivit: How close the player has to look at the item to render the nametag.
lootbeams.config.nameplateOutline.toolti: Should the nameplate be bordered. Set to false for flat nametag with a background.
lootbeams.config.nameplateIncludeCount.t: Should the nameplate include the item count.
lootbeams.config.renderVanillaRarities.t: Should vanilla rarities be rendered below the nameplate.
lootbeams.config.customNameplateRarities: Any custom rarities you want to render below the nameplate. (Must be the line below the item name)
lootbeams.config.nameplateCondition.tool: The general condition for nameplates to render.
lootbeams.config.nameplateWhitelist.tool: Items that should render nameplates regardless of the render condition.
lootbeams.config.nameplateBlacklist.tool: Items that should not render nameplates no matter what.
lootbeams.config.landingSound.tooltip: Should a sound play when the item lands.
lootbeams.config.soundCondition.tooltip: The general condition for the sound to play.
lootbeams.config.soundWhitelist.tooltip: Items that should play a sound regardless of the render condition.
lootbeams.config.soundBlacklist.tooltip: Items that should not play a sound no matter what.
